Package com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.product.list

Class ProductList

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.product.list.ProductList
  • public class ProductList
extends java.lang.Object
    The ProductList class provides functionality for maintaining a list of products that have been ordered for a particular company. The list is a LinkedAbstractList and company's employees can add or remove products. Also, the administrator can set the list cap for total products at any time. The system can also see the number of spaces remaining for the product based on the current list size and maximum capacity.
    Author:
    Arthur Vargas

      Constructors

      ProductList​(Product p, int cap)
      Creates a new LinkedAbstractList of products.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProductList

        public ProductList​(Product p,
                   int cap)
        Creates a new LinkedAbstractList of products. The capacity of the list is passed by the user and set using the setCapacity method which checks that the capacity falls within the minimum and max values.
        Parameters:
        cap - The requested enrollment cap.
        p - the product to add to the list or holding

    • Method Detail

      • setCapacity

        public void setCapacity​(int capacity)
        Sets the cap on the number of products allowed to be added to the list. If the passed value is less than 1 or greater than 30 an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. Also, if the current product list size is greater than the passed capacity than the IAE is thrown.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the requested capacity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed capacity is less than 1, greater than 30, or less than the current size of the list.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Gets the number of products that are allowed to be added in a particular list.
        Returns:
        listCapacity the cap on the number of products that can be added to the list.

      • add

        public void add​(Product p)
        Adds the product to the list if there is room in the list and if no other exceptions are thrown from the LinkedAbstractList class when attempting to add the product to the end of the list.
        Parameters:
        p - the product to add to the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the add() method returns false or if an exception is thrown from the LinkedAbstractList class when attempting to add the product to the end of the list.

      • drop

        public void drop​(Product p)
        Removes a product from the list if it are present on the list and if product is not null.
        Parameters:
        p - The product to remove from the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the product is null or if the LinkedAbstractList class throws an exception during the removal process.

      • getRemainingCapacity

        public int getRemainingCapacity()
        Gets the spaces in the list for additional products.
        Returns:
        The difference between the capacity and the current number of products in the list.

      • canAdd

        public boolean canAdd​(Product s)
        Checks whether a product can be added to the list. A product would be allowed if it is not null and if the current enrollment is less than the enrollment cap.
        Parameters:
        s - the product to check whether it can be added to the list.
        Returns:
        True if product can be added. False otherwise.

      • getsNumberOnHold

        public int getsNumberOnHold()
        Gets the number of products on hold for the product list.
        Returns:
        The number of products on the holding list.
